title: Adam Thomas responds to Emmerdale exit rumours
text:
(Picture: ITV) Adam Thomas has addressed reports that he is to quit Emmerdale with his usual and much loved tongue in cheek humour, jokingly inviting people onto his rumoured chat show while telling fans not to believe everything they read. 
The Sun had claimed that Adam was set to depart his role as Adam Thomas after eight years in the role to pursue presenting opportunities following his success in I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here!
However, Adam appears to have given viewers hope by playing down the reports, tweeting:
Don't believe everything you read people 
— adam thomas (@adamthomas21) March 30, 2017 
In other news who wants to be a guest on my new show 
— adam thomas (@adamthomas21) March 30, 2017 

Adam’s co-star and close friend Danny Miller also appeared to address the rumours in a video by picking up several free copies of The Sun and putting them in the bin although it is not confirmed that this was in relation to the story about Adam.
Who likes The Sun newspaper? #thescum 
A post shared by Simon Booth (@coach_simon) on Mar 29, 2017 at 11:17pm PDT 
An Emmerdale spokesperson told Metro.co.uk: ‘We never comment on speculation or future storylines.’
Fans are deeply invested in Adam’s character, with most very much behind his close friendship with Aaron Dingle and his relationship with Victoria Barton, with whom the popular character is planning to start a family.

He has been at the centre of a series of dramatic storylines including discovering that John Barton was his dad, facing the devastation that baby Johnny isn’t his child and dealing with the devastating death of his sister Holly.
